sen.j: 藤原 永手（ふじわら の ながて、和銅7年（714年） - 宝亀2年2月21日 (旧暦)（771年3月15日））は、奈良時代の政治家。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Nagate (AD 714 to March 15, AD 771) was a politician in the Nara period.
FUJIWARA no Nagate (AD 714 to March 15, AD 771) was a politician during the Nara period.
FUJIWARA no Nagate (714 to March 15, 771) was a politician during the Nara period.

sen.j: 参議藤原房前の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Sangi (councilor) FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.
He was the second son of Sangi (councilor) FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.
He was the second son of Sangi (councilor) FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.

sen.j: 正一位左大臣、贈太政大臣。
sen.e: He was Senior First Rank Minister of the Left, and was posthumously raised to the post of High Chancellor.
He was Senior First Rank Minister of the Left, and was posthumously raised to the post of High Chancellor.
He was Senior First Rank Minister of the Left, and was posthumously raised to the post of High Chancellor.

sen.j: 長岡大臣と称する。
sen.e: He was called Nagaoka Minister.
He was called the Nagaoka Minister.
He was called the Nagaoka Minister.

sen.j: 藤原北家の祖藤原房前の次男として生まれる
sen.e: He was born as the second son of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, who was the originator of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He was born as the second son of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, who was the originator of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
He was born as the second son of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, who was the originator of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: しかし、長男の藤原鳥養が夭折したため、実質的に藤原北家の長として孝謙天皇の代より重用された。
sen.e: However, because the eldest son FUJIWARA no Ukai died young, he was substantially the eldest son of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and was promoted to important positions by Emperor Koken.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, because the eldest son FUJIWARA no Ukai died young, he was substantially the eldest son of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and was promoted to important positions by Emperor Koken.
However, because the eldest son FUJIWARA no Ukai died young, he was substantially the eldest son of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and was promoted to important positions by Emperor Koken.

sen.j: 藤原仲麻呂とは対立関係にあったとされた。
sen.e: He was assumed to be in the confrontation against FUJIWARA no Nakamaro.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He was assumed to be in confrontation against FUJIWARA no Nakamaro.
He was assumed to be in confrontation against FUJIWARA no Nakamaro.

sen.j: 天平宝字元年（757年）の道祖王廃太子の際には、孝謙天皇の皇嗣として藤原豊成とともに塩焼王を推挙した。
sen.e: In AD 757 when Funado no Okimi deposed Crown Prince, he, together with FUJIWARA no Toyonari, recommended Prince Shioyaki as a Crown Prince of Emperor Koken.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In AD 757 when Funado no Okimi deposed Crown Prince, he, together with FUJIWARA no Toyonari, recommended Prince Shioyaki as the Crown Prince of Emperor Koken.
In AD 757 when Funado no Okimi deposed Crown Prince, he, together with FUJIWARA no Toyonari, recommended Prince Shioyaki as the Crown Prince of Emperor Koken.

sen.j: （結局、仲麻呂の意中であった大炊王（のちの淳仁天皇）が皇太子となる）
sen.e: (After all, Prince Oi [later Emperor Junnin] who was the favorite of Nakamaro became Crown Prince)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (After all, Prince Oi [later Emperor Junnin] who was the favorite of Nakamaro became Crown Prince)
(After all, Prince Oi [later Emperor Junnin] who was the favorite of Nakamaro became Crown Prince)

sen.j: 同2年（758年）8月25日に開かれた仲麻呂による官号改易の際の太政官の会議に議政官で唯一欠席している。
sen.e: On August 25 AD 758, during the Daijokan (Grand Council of State)'s conference amendment of official posts by Nakamaro, he was the only absent giseikan (legislative official).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: On August 25 AD 758, during the Daijokan (Grand Council of State)'s conference amendment of official posts by Nakamaro, he was the only absent giseikan (legislative official).
On August 25 AD 758, during the Daijokan (Grand Council of State)'s conference amendment of official posts by Nakamaro, he was the only absent giseikan (legislative official).

sen.j: 仲麻呂が朝廷の全権を把握すると、石川年足あるいは文室浄三についで太政官の第3位にあったものの、政治的には不遇の状況に置かれた。
sen.e: After Nakamaro gripped the full powers of the court, he was with ISHIKAWA no Toshitari or FUNYA no Kiyomi and became the third rank in Daijokan (Grand Council of State), but was placed politically in a misfortune situation.

After Nakamaro gripped full powers of the court, he was with ISHIKAWA no Toshitari or FUNYA no Kiyomi and became the third rank in Daijokan (Grand Council of State), but was placed politically in a misfortune situation.

After Nakamaro gripped full powers of the court, he was with ISHIKAWA no Toshitari or FUNYA no Kiyomi and became the third rank in Daijokan (Grand Council of State), but was placed politically in a misfortune situation.

sen.j: 恵美押勝の乱では孝謙天皇・道鏡側に参加して活躍した。
sen.e: In the Rebellion of Emi no Oshikatsu, he participated actively in the side of Emperor Koken and Dokyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the Rebellion of Emi no Oshikatsu, he participated actively on sides with Emperor Koken and Dokyo.
In the Rebellion of Emi no Oshikatsu, he participated actively on sides with Emperor Koken and Dokyo.

sen.j: 道鏡政権が成立し右大臣豊成が薨去した天平宝字9年（765年）以後、薨去まで太政官の筆頭公卿の地位を保った。
sen.e: After Dokyo's political power was established and Minister of the Right Toyonari died in AD 765, he kept his position of highest rank high court noble in Daijokan (Grand Council of state).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After Dokyo's political power was established and Minister of the Right Toyonari died in AD 765, he kept his position of the highest rank high court noble in Daijokan (Grand Council of state).
After Dokyo's political power was established and Minister of the Right Toyonari died in AD 765, he kept his position of the highest rank high court noble in Daijokan (Grand Council of state).

sen.j: 称徳天皇（孝謙）死後の皇嗣問題では、天武天皇系の文室浄三のちにその弟文室大市を推した吉備真備に対抗した。
sen.e: In the Crown Prince postmortem problem of Emperor Shotoku (Emperor Koken), he was in rivalry with KIBI no Makibi who supported FUNYA no Kiyomi from Emperor Tenmu 's series and later his younger brother FUNYA no Ochi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the Crown Prince postmortem problem of Emperor Shotoku (Emperor Koken), he was in rivalry with KIBI no Makibi who supported FUNYA no Kiyomi from Emperor Tenmu 's series and later his younger brother FUNYA no Ochi.

In the Crown Prince postmortem problem of Emperor Shotoku (Emperor Koken), he was in rivalry with KIBI no Makibi who supported FUNYA no Kiyomi from Emperor Tenmu 's series and later his younger brother FUNYA no Ochi.

sen.j: 藤原式家の藤原良継・藤原百川兄弟とともに天智天皇系の白壁王（のちの光仁天皇）の擁立に尽力した。
sen.e: With the brothers FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu, FUJIWARA no Momokawa of the Fujiwara Shikike (a sub branch of Fujiwara family), he endeavored for the support of Shirakabe no okimi (later Emperor Konin) from Emperor Tenchi's series.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: With the brothers FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu, FUJIWARA no Momokawa of the Fujiwara Shikike (a sub branch of Fujiwara family), he endeavored for the support of Shirakabe no okimi (later Emperor Konin) from Emperor Tenchi's series.

With the brothers FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu, FUJIWARA no Momokawa of the Fujiwara Shikike (a sub branch of Fujiwara family), he endeavored for the support of Shirakabe no okimi (later Emperor Konin) from Emperor Tenchi's series.

sen.j: また近年、その皇太子については山部親王（のちの桓武天皇）を推した良継らの反対を押し切って、他戸親王を立てたという説が唱えられている。
sen.e: Moreover, in recent years, there was a theory about that Crown Prince saying that, he overcame the opposition of Yoshitsugu and others who supported Imperial Prince Yamanobe (later Emperor Kammu) and enthroned Imperial Prince Osabe.

Moreover, in recent years, there is a theory that says the Crown Prince overcame the opposition of Yoshitsugu and others who supported Imperial Prince Yamanobe (later Emperor Kammu) and enthroned Imperial Prince Osabe.
sen.cmt: thatが多いので減らしました。
sen.e: Moreover, in recent years, there is a theory that says the Crown Prince overcame the opposition of Yoshitsugu and others who supported Imperial Prince Yamanobe (later Emperor Kammu) and enthroned Imperial Prince Osabe.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 天平9年（737年） 従五位下。
sen.e: In AD 737, he became Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade.
In AD 737, he became Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade.
In 737, he became Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade.

sen.j: 天平21年（749年） 従四位下。
sen.e: In AD 749, he became Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade.
In AD 749, he became Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade.
In 749, he became Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade.

sen.j: 天平勝宝2年（750年） 従四位上。
sen.e: In AD 750, he became Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade.
In AD 750, he became Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade.
In 750, he became Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade.

sen.j: 天平勝宝4年（752年） 大倭守。
sen.e: In AD 752, he became Guide of Tai (Japan).
In AD 752, he became Guide of Tai (Japan).
In 752, he became Guide of Tai (Japan).

sen.j: 天平勝宝6年（754年） 従三位。
sen.e: In AD 754, he became Junior Third Rank.
In AD 754, he became Junior Third Rank.
In 754, he became Junior Third Rank.

sen.j: 天平勝宝6年（754年） 太皇太后宮子の崩御の造山司。
sen.e: In AD 754, he became Taikotaigogu daijin (officer of the institution for serving to the grand Empress dowager) for making hill grave for the death.
In AD 754, he became Taikotaigogu daijin (officer of the institution for serving to the grand Empress dowager) for making hill grave for the death.
In 754, he became Taikotaigogu daijin (officer of the institution for serving to the grand Empress dowager) for making hill grave for the death.

sen.j: 天平勝宝8歳（756年） 聖武天皇崩御の際の葬儀司装束司。
sen.e: In AD 756, he became the funeral ceremony master and clothes coordinator when Emperor Shomu passed away.
In AD 756, he became the funeral ceremony master and clothes coordinator when Emperor Shomu passed away.
In 756, he became the funeral ceremony master and clothes coordinator when Emperor Shomu passed away.

sen.j: 天平勝宝8歳（756年） 京職、兼侍従、中務省。
sen.e: In AD 756, he became Capital Bureau and Palace staff of Ministry of Central Affairs.
In AD 756, he became Capital Bureau and Palace staff of Ministry of Central Affairs.
In 756, he became Capital Bureau and Palace staff of Ministry of Central Affairs.

sen.j: 天平勝宝9歳（757年） 中納言。
sen.e: In AD 757, he became Middle Counselor.
In AD 757, he became Middle Counselor.
In 757, he became Middle Counselor.

sen.j: 天平宝字4年（760年） 仁正(光明)皇太后崩御の際の装束司。
sen.e: In AD 760, he became the clothes coordinator when Empress Dowager Komyo (Nisho) passed away.
In AD 760, he became the clothes coordinator when Empress Dowager Komyo (Nisho) passed away.
In 760, he became the clothes coordinator when Empress Dowager Komyo (Nisho) passed away.

sen.j: 天平宝字7年（763年） 兵部省（式部省）。
sen.e: In AD 763, he served for Hyobusho (Ministry of Military) (the Ministry of Ceremonial).
In AD 763, he served for Hyobusho (Ministry of Military) (the Ministry of Ceremonial).
In 763, he served for Hyobusho (Ministry of Military) (the Ministry of Ceremonial).

sen.j: 天平宝字8年（764年） 藤原仲麻呂の乱に際し正三位、大納言。
sen.e: In AD 764, he became Senior Third Rank Major Counselor during the Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro.
In AD 764, he became Senior Third Rank Major Counselor during the Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro.
In 764, he became Senior Third Rank Major Counselor during the Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro.

sen.j: 天平神護元年（765年） 乱鎮圧の功により勲二等。
sen.e: In AD 765, he became Order of Second Class because of his achievement in repression of the rebellion.
In AD 765, he became Order of Second Class because of his achievement in repression of the rebellion.
In 765, he became Order of Second Class because of his achievement in repression of the rebellion.

sen.j: 天平神護元年（765年） 御装束司長官。
sen.e: In AD 765, he became the director official who handled important rituals.
In AD 765, he became the director official who handled important rituals.
In 765, he became the director official who handled important rituals.

sen.j: 天平神護2年（766年） 従二位、右大臣、正二位。
sen.e: In AD 766, he became Junior Second Rank, Minister of the Right, Senior Second Rank.
In AD 766, he became Junior Second Rank, Minister of the Right, Senior Second Rank.
In 766, he became Junior Second Rank, Minister of the Right, Senior Second Rank.

sen.j: 天平神護2年（766年） 道鏡の法王就任に際し、左大臣。
sen.e: In AD 766, he became Minister of the Left when Dokyo was appointed the Pope.
In AD 766, he became Minister of the Left when Dokyo was appointed the Pope.
In 766, he became Minister of the Left when Dokyo was appointed the Pope.

sen.j: 神護景雲3年（769年） 従一位。
sen.e: In AD 769, he became Junior First Rank.
In AD 769, he became Junior First Rank.
In 769, he became Junior First Rank.

sen.j: 神護景雲3年（769年） 孝謙天皇病気により、近衛府・外衛府・左右兵衛府を管轄。
sen.e: In AD 769, he had jurisdiction over the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards, Gaiefu(guard)and Right Division of Middle Palace Guards, because of Emperor Koken's sickness.
In AD 769, he had jurisdiction over the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards, Gaiefu(guard)and Right Division of Middle Palace Guards, because of Emperor Koken's sickness.
In 769, he had jurisdiction over the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards, Gaiefu(guard)and Right Division of Middle Palace Guards, because of Emperor Koken's sickness.

sen.j: 宝亀元年（770年） 称徳天皇崩御に際し、右大臣吉備真備らと協議し、白壁王を擁立し光仁天皇即位。
sen.e: In AD 770, when Emperor Shotoku passed away, he compromised with Minister of the Right KIBI no Makibi and enthroned Shirakabe no okimi as Emperor Konin.
In AD 770, when Emperor Shotoku passed away, he compromised with Minister of the Right KIBI no Makibi and enthroned Shirakabe no okimi as Emperor Konin.
In 770, when Emperor Shotoku passed away, he compromised with Minister of the Right KIBI no Makibi and enthroned Shirakabe no okimi as Emperor Konin.

sen.j: 永手は正一位に昇叙。
sen.e: Nagate was promoted as Senior First Rank.
Nagate was promoted as Senior First Rank.
Nagate was promoted as Senior First Rank.

sen.j: 宝亀2年（771年）2月21日 病気にて58歳で薨去。
sen.e: On February 21, AD 771, he passed away of sickness at the age of 58.
On February 21, AD 771, he passed away of sickness at the age of 58.
On February 21, 771, he passed away of sickness at the age of 58.

sen.j: 太政大臣を追贈。
sen.e: He was postmortem awarded as Grand Minister of state.
He was postmortem awarded as Grand Minister of state.
He was postmortem awarded as Grand Minister of state.
